title: KFC786
author: KFC786
content: Today I joined Bitcointalk and I as I am new here and I do not the rules. But still recently I have learned that Satoshi was the man that they build Bitcointalk forum so that they might be able to handle people problems and also understandings. But I will see that how much I will learn from this forum. I have high hopes. I know I am late here but still I want to become knowledgeable and also gain access to the mysteries of Bitcoin and also Blockchain and I am very excited. Bitcointalk forum is also growing very fast because a lot of people come here and they get a lot to learn.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Take note Satoshi is no longer active here since 2010 so you won't get response or help from him.Since you are newbie sticky thread in this section should be the right thread for you or start reading this "Newbies - Read before posting"Or if you are looking for a big library for Bitcoin then you can check this "Big Library of Bitcoin & Blockchain Books" then learn from them.For development check this https://github.com/yjjnls/awesome-blockchain

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: Hello and welcome to the forum. It's great that you joined the forum to learn. Everyone here is Satoshi's soldier, so this is definitely the best place to learn about cryptocurrency. You can learn a lot by reading the threads here. If necessary, use the search function before starting a new thread here. You must follow the forum rules and refrain from spamming.

comments.author: Iroh
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. Here, you would learn all you would need to know about bitcoin and cryptocurrencies by reading the various threads on here. You could also ask whatever questions you may have and someone is sure to give you a detailed explanation.¬†¬†Here‚Äôs the unofficial rules of the forum, Make sure to familiarize yourself with it. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Welcome to the forum, please note that your first journey start with you abiding with the forum's rules and regulations to keep and direct you right to a proper positioning as expected from the initial goal of this community, in addition to this, i will also like to add you two links for recommendation on how to post1. posting etiquetteshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5184741.0#post_altgiveaway2. Beginners and Help Encyclopediahttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5364418.0#post_point118The second one i sent has almost the complete links to informations you would ever like to request or know about this forum and the bitcoin at large all compiled together, read and learn from other links provided as well by members and dont plagiarize, most importantly.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Welcome to the best forum to learn bitcoin. Please adhere to the rules here and focus on learning first before thing.Other forum members have shared links to help you through here.There are have been many discussions here so before proceeding to ask or drop a new thread please use the search engine. The link below will help you how to use ithttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5276341.0Concerning bitcoin, you can learn everything here, if you are having problems about anything do well to ask. We have experts to guide youHere is a link about bitcoin walletshttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1631151.0

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Welcome to the forum, it‚Äôs a great place to learn about bitcoin. People on here are mostly good guys, you need to stay smart though. As with everywhere there‚Äôs a small minority of people who ruin it for everybody else. There are a lot of really helpful people so feel free to fire any questions out & I‚Äôm sure somebody will try their best to assist you.You‚Äôre not late, it‚Äôs never too late to learn about bitcoin. Enjoy your time here.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: Quote from: KFC786 on December 20, 2022, 04:38:09 PMI know I am late here but still I want to become knowledgeable and also gain access to the mysteries of Bitcoin and also Blockchain and I am very excited. Bitcointalk forum is also growing very fast because a lot of people come here and they get a lot to learn. it's not too late, it's a great time to enter the bitcoin world. many complain about the current market decline and decreasing interest in bitcoin, but for those who really want to get to know the subject, such periods are ideal. much better than a few months ago when the value was 4x higher, it was harder to reach a more significant amount. plus, some unstable services dropped.I would say a much healthier state than a year ago.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. The first few days can be daunting and confusing, and many newbies drop out before making 5 posts. Would check back to see how far you go.From your write up, it's pretty obvious English is not uour first language. This doesn't cause any sort of discrimination here as long as yourboists are at least readable and understandable, but if you are stronger using your local language, you can check the list of local birds and threads available to know if yours is represented.There you cin communicate freely ad learn from a more close knit community.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: We always welcome people to read and learn from us. The forum is a great place for beginners and experts to get together, share their knowledge and learn from each other. I suggest you to visit those sticky threads, you will get a good idea about the forum and how people are helpful here. These are really great reading and perhaps should be in your bookmarks. I hope you enjoy your time on our forum!

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Quote from: KFC786 on December 20, 2022, 04:38:09 PMToday I joined Bitcointalk and I as I am new here and I do not the rules. But still recently I have learned that Satoshi was the man that they build Bitcointalk forum so that they might be able to handle people problems and also understandings. But I will see that how much I will learn from this forum. I have high hopes. It's good to have someone like you in here. We are all different in our ways and when we are together, it makes BTT unique with a vast collection of ideas, yeah.... ofcourse that's what we all do here and I'm happy to have you join the train.QuoteI know I am late here but still I want to become knowledgeable and also gain access to the mysteries of Bitcoin and also Blockchain and I am very excited. Bitcointalk forum is also growing very fast because a lot of people come here and they get a lot to learn. No one is ever late to anything static; it depends on the effort and competency all together. I'm just surprised how you know that BTT is growing fast? when you just got registered?? Lol... Never mind, that was a mind twister anyways.. just do what you have to do and give it your best. Don't push too hard, you're just gonna mess up; give in your whole interest and you'll get to celebrate someone onday -- just as I celebrated you.Sandra üßë‚Äçü¶∞

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: KFC786 on December 20, 2022, 04:38:09 PMToday I joined Bitcointalk and I as I am new here and I do not the rules. But still recently I have learned that Satoshi was the man that they build Bitcointalk forum so that they might be able to handle people problems and also understandings. But I will see that how much I will learn from this forum. I have high hopes. You are welcome to the forum. If your primary purpose of joining this forum is to learn about bitcoin, then you are in the right place. As a student you must be willing to learn from every member member of the forum that is giving out the right information. You must be patient, humble and tolerant. Don't be scared of asking questions and don't be offended when you are corrected or criticized. Your speed or ability to learn will largely depend on how committed you are to the forum.¬†QuoteI know I am late here but still I want to become knowledgeable and also gain access to the mysteries of Bitcoin and also Blockchain and I am very excited. Bitcointalk forum is also growing very fast because a lot of people come here and they get a lot to learn. Even if you think you are late, it is better late than never. But I don't really think you came in late because learning in the bitcoin space is a lifelong journey. This is because the bitcoin space would always exist and there would always be innovations and new discoveries. And you would be surprised that billions of people are far behind you in this sector.

comments.author: sheenshane
comments.body: We always welcomed users who are just willing to learn about Bitcoin or the entire cryptocurrency. I suggest you read it first before deciding to post because there are too many existing topics that you're looking for on this board.¬† Find those pinned or sticky topics above and you'll find out helpful topics that increase your knowledge and knows what's dos and dont's here in the forum. Quote from: KFC786 on December 20, 2022, 04:38:09 PMBut still recently I have learned that Satoshi was the man ...There's no clear identity or gender regarding on Satoshi's personality, it could be a group of people, a man or a woman, no one knows.¬† Not unless, if you know this founder of Bitcoin personally. You're in the right place to explore the beauty of blockchain technology but you're not late, there's plenty of time to know more about Bitcoin.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: They're lots of sections in this forum that will help you learn new things about bitcoin. Stick around this section and ask questions on subject you don't understand. Read articles relating to bitcoin on other sites and share your findings with forum members. That's how you'll learn new things everyday. Moreover, You are most welcomed to the bitcointalk forum where good activity brings rewards in form of knowledge and networks. With consistency many people will know you in the forum and as well communicate with you if you've got a service to render. Focus on helping members learn from your research and perspectives. Good luck.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: Welcome to the bitcointalk forum indeed you are in the right place to gain all the knowledge you need to secure yourself through your Bitcoin /cryptocurrncy journey.First, you should read and get familiar with the forum rules and also improve on your writing skills as it looks as if you are not too good in English if you are a native of English, then you have a lot to improve on, but if you have a local language we also have local boards were you can easily attract with those from your region that speak your language, that way you can get easy and simple to understand help and guides that could help you. The

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: Satoshi isn't active anymore, users who has a lot power to control this forum are the administrators e.g. theymos and Cyrus. Next it's global moderators and then moderators, they can delete anyone post if they broke this forum rules.If you want to learn on this forum, I advice it's better for you to read the rules and sticky thread in every section you're interested, read more and talk less.Quote from: KFC786 on December 20, 2022, 04:38:09 PMBitcointalk forum is also growing very fast because a lot of people come here and they get a lot to learn. How you can say this? does this is your alt account or you have someone that introduce you to join this forum?

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Newbie kit‚ñ∂Ô∏è Forum's ‚≠êRules, ‚≠êranks, positions, badges, ‚≠êeverything about ranks, activity, merit‚ñ∂Ô∏è Read before posting‚ñ∂Ô∏è [General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?‚ñ∂Ô∏è 5 Resources to teach Average Joe about Bitcoin‚ñ∂Ô∏è [GUIDE] How to Create a Strong/Secure Password‚ñ∂Ô∏è [GUIDE] How to Safely Download and Verify Electrumüî• Welcome

comments.author: romeitaly
comments.body: Hello there! I'm also newbie in this forum and still learning some things about cryptocurrency. I also here to earn some rewards for my schooling. I always make sure to post some good quality content as I can. Our good quality post can also helps the community to grow more effective and efficient for the cryptocurrency learners.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: romeitaly on January 06, 2023, 08:18:58 AMHello there! I'm also newbie in this forum and still learning some things about cryptocurrency.~snip~It's strange that you still consider yourself a beginner, so even though you don't have too many posts, you still registered on the forum in 2017. Unless you bought an account (I hope you didn't), you should have learned at least some basic things that would be in line with your rank.Quote from: KFC786 on December 20, 2022, 04:38:09 PMI know I am late here...It's never too late to start learning something new, you just need a little time and perseverance, and in that case you can reach some older members in knowledge or in rank. Let's see what you can achieve this year Edit : it seems that this is the alt account of user @fennic, now I remembered the very obvious merit abuse between those two accounts - unfortunately I hoped in vain

comments.author: KingsDen
comments.body: Quote from: KFC786 on December 20, 2022, 04:38:09 PM. But still recently I have learned that Satoshi was the man that they build Bitcointalk forum so that they might be able to handle people problems and also understandings. I am not sure that the reason that satoshi created this forum is to solve people's problems and I really doubt that he has soft people's problem here before or you can be specific by saying that he and other developers solve problems that are related to Bitcoin.So in this present day that satoshi is no more it is also bitcoin related problems that are solved here and not people's personal family problems.I welcome you to the forum and I advise you to stick to your goal here (learning)because that is the right direction to go
